title: Patch Chat with the Playtest Team - 6.16, the Pre-Pre Worlds Patch
body:
What's up guys! I'm Aesah, and I'll be filling in for Gentleman Gustaf to bring you today's Patch Chat, which will be posted here on Dev Corner every two weeks along with the release of each [new patch](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/patch/patch-616-notes). 

I recently joined Riot's Playtest Team, a group of Diamond+ players who play with the new champions, reworks, balance tweaks, items, and map updates before they are released. It's our job to the test the changes that our designers come up with and ensure that we're introducing positive changes to LoL in terms of both balance and fun. 

In 6.16, we're excited to be releasing Kled, the Cantankerous Cavalier to bring some new dynamics with his dismounting/re-mounting mechanic to the Rift. Otherwise this patch is relatively minor- there are a few support changes with buffs to Lulu and Nautilus, while toning back Sona's newfound powers to a more reasonable level. Irelia and Viktor have also been performing just a bit too well, so we're cutting their power a bit too.

All of us on the Playtest Team are avid gamers so feel free to talk to us as fellow LoL players. Additionally, you guys can use this opportunity to ask us anything about what it's like to work at Riot as a playtester. While we can't answer specific questions about anything that would be considered a leak, the Playtest Team will be around for the next few hours to try to answer as many questions as we can.

Adam "Afic" Cohen

Will you ever be buffing Garen any time soon ? Or have you basically forgotten about him.
Buffing? He is still a stupid cheap champ when played right.

I don't think we have any plans to buff Garen. AFAIK there's still a good amount of our playerbase that view him as very strong even though he's not played in competitive, and that's important to take into consideration as well.

Can you talk about what exactly is preventing him from being buffed? As long time Garen player in diamond+ elo (masters peak, d1 multiple season, d5+ in dynamic queue era) I believe he suffers from an overly weak early game. Not even relative to what he "used" to be, but relative to the strengths of other melee champions who completely lack any sort of ability to be a threat out of directly melee range - examples like tryndamere, darius, irelia, jax, who all scale equally as well or better and have the same core gameplay as garen. Bringing kill potential and little else to a team. 

I don't think he needs any changes mid-late game in any form, but facts like his Q is strictly the better ability for trading early game because it's damage is both upfront and higher per-skill-rank in terms of what you gain for ranking them in any scenario where the enemy champ isn't completely isolated for greater than 3/4ths of the duration. His Q should be his utility skill but its his best dueling skill cause you need to get out before the silence is off or lose all trades once the enemy can retaliate. His early game is overly frail and the sluggish nature of level 1-3 spin (5 ticks), along with his unrewarding skill paths is super unfulfilling as a long time garen player.

He can't even jungle because of his W not stacking quickly enough on jungle camps, so he's an easily counter picked niche hero, with low role flexibility and a poor early game. He has so many factors working against his ability to reach a point where he can perform consistently at a high level of play, and in my opinion, just needs a small boost to his early or a redistribution of his Q and E damage to make E THE damage skill and Q THE utility skill that makes it more rewarding to play him. 

As a final gripe when he was made more kitable by reducing silence, move speed %, duration and base ms from his kit his channel times on his Q could have been compensated in some way but skilled players can often escape from you during the animation, at times the damage has been applied and people can still flash after the ability has 'landed' even though they shouldn't be able to, due to silence. 

tl;dr

early game overly weak
q > e max for some reason for DAMAGE purposes, when it should be q < e
q cast time makes for a frustratingly unreliable ability that makes him struggle significantly more vs skilled players

I am a Garen main, so I am in absolute shock that someone in their right mind would think that hes strong let alone "very strong"? In a state of the game where almost every champ builds an offensive item with a slow (ice gaunt, rylai, frozen mallet) he gets kited to death, literally. He has a non scaling, single target form of CC in the form of a 1.5 second silence, and that is it. He is one of the slowest champions in the game (awful mobility), and his Q that gives him a move speed bonus for a short duration doesn't scale either (no increase in move speed amount or duration), but hey at least his Q breaks a slow, only to be vulnerable to any slow after Q is cast. So his Q only scales in dmg, his W is one of; if not the only, passive stacking abilities that has a CAP, and his E really only scales in dmg anyways in the form of "ticks". I mean c'mon people. The champ is literally just a meat shield, who can absolutely delete the enemy support for Killstealing that last kill (Cause he would be the villain).

Yet a few patches ago, Gnar; who is a ranged, tank, CC machine, with decent mobility, who, oh by the way! does % health damage too actually gets a buff???  Huh? Who was part of that group that said "Ya know what... We need to make that ranged, tank with lots of CC and % health dmg even stronger!" #gnarbuffs?

I normally am against balancing a champion based on its spot in the competitive scene, so in Garen's case I'd rather point out that we have some serious experts on him apart from myself who believe his early game is a bit messy and needs tuning, and give above all reasons, techincal and actual reasons on why that is...

I do believe besides his early game weaknesses he needs something ELSE like, (just an idea), a 1.5 slow immunity on his Q when activated, or at least a slow reduction; a little more speed when running towards the Villain, something like this to compensate his speed nerfs.

Any plans to address {{champion:92}} 's "quick combo" anytime soon?

Besides it being gated by ping, inconsistent and being unclear to non Riven mains If any sort of patch broke/fixed this (such as the one with overlapping CC) Riven would most likely be in a either super strong or super weak state and emergency adjustments would have to be made. Why not circumvent this problem and nip it in the bud now while also making the champion more consistent as a whole? 

I can understand the hesitation to touch her because she currently sees play at high elo but pick and play rate along with other statistics are tricky to balance around as they can often be skewed (see:Riven win rate % by games played) and should be viewed in a dubious fashion when looking at overall champion health. 

Its a bug thats existed since the champions initial release that consumes a large portion of her powerbudget and 4 years later Riot still has not decided on rather they want to  remove the "quick combo" or give it proper support.

No plans to address it as far as I know.  

There is something to be said for extremely high mastery curves of champions through super unique/intricate interactions/inputs.  Just look at Nidalee for example.  Removing the auto attack reset on her R had a non trivial number of people pretty upset, saying that we shouldn't be removing complex or high skill cap mechanics.  

I am of the opinion that some champions should be easier to learn, and some should remain more difficult to master.  I'm not sure what the sweet spot is for how many champions this applies to, but Riven to me is one of the champions that should remain difficult to master.

My only real complaint about this is that it makes learning that champ very difficult. In my case, I was getting stomped by Riven, so I followed the usual advice given: play any champ that is giving you trouble to figure out their weaknesses.

But the different between what I could pull off as Riven and what my average enemy Riven can pull off is so different all I got out of the few games I tried was 'hope the enemy Riven is terrible.' I didn't learn her weaknesses, I learned she is hard to play, and unless I bothered putting in the amount of time and energy neccesary towards mastering a champ I don't care about at all, I wouldn't be able to learn her weaknesses. It sucked.

>Removing the auto attack reset on her R had a non trivial number of people pretty upset, saying that we shouldn't be removing complex or high skill cap mechanics.

So is this your personal opinion or the general consensus of the balance team?
Because Id argue that this philosophy directly conflicts with the direction you took{{champion:13}} in and amongst other more general changes overtime.

Id also argue that theres a difference between ward-hopping and "pulling an insec" rather than "having to playing OSU" to complete a certain combo within a shorter time frame. Whats the line between a convoluted input and an more meaningful-acceptable one?

 As I mentioned before** Im not trying to get this removed outright** but rather I want to see Riot take an official stance on it with proper support. If not for the people learning her then for the sake of clarity and proper feedback. Thanks in advance.

The most recent Nidalee change that Afic referred to is a great example; /r/Nidaleemains referred to it as doomsday, and as a Nid main myself, I was 10/10 levels of sad about the change.

I agree that Riven's quick combo makes no sense, but I also am pretty sure most Riven players would go crazy if quick combo was removed. I would personally be about 9/10 levels of sad. I don't know for sure whether there is "an official Riot stance" on this topic, but I don't think it would be beneficial to do so because things can change- this was before I worked here, but "Solo Q will return" is a good example of tying our hands with an official stance instead of dynamically adapting to what we think is right at the time.

Anyway, from what I can tell, it seems highly unlikely that Riven's quick combo will be removed any time soon.

Those Nidalee changes WERE good changes though. The Nidalee changes hardly had any effect on how the general public percieved and played Nidalee. She stills lots of play at higher levels and more or less her win/pick rates havent changed dramatically but it served its purpose to reign in her power at higher levels of play  so in that regard it WAS an effective change with very little backfire.


>"but "Solo Q will return" is a good example of tying our hands with an official stance instead of dynamically adapting to what we think is right at the time."

Removing  and/or completely redefining  a long time existing game mode and fixing a characters bugs are such vastly different entitys im suprised you even found a way to compare the two .

The Solo Q changes affected literally everybody who played rank thus the outcry was 100X fold because ALOT more people felt thier opinions needed to be heard .


Buffs/Nerfs and tentative changes are the lifeblood of this game and happen literally on a weekly basis . If Riven were to have her QC removed only a small portion of the playerbase would be affected (see:The people who put enough time in to master it) and character health along with over all gameplay health as a whole should EASILY take priority over that.

If you would discard personal bia's and community outrage phobias then really dig deep and look at the pro's and cons of "the quick combo" then discuss it with your peers I think you would come to the same agreement that SOMETHING has to be done about it and that letting it just exist in its current limbo state is a bad idea.

I remember seeing this in the Dev Corner previously, noting it would be set for 6.16:

[Link to tower changes.](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/B2y4p4vE-pre-worlds-early-game-update?show=flat)

Yet I don't see any mention of the proposed tower AI changes in the patch. Has this been moved to a later patch, or given up on entirely?

Here's the relevant quote from Meddler:

>     Make towers acknowledge calls for help if the ally being hit's outside their range, but the enemy hitting them is under the tower. At present it's unintuitive and really punishing that if you're zoned really far back from your tower enemy champions can stand under it and hit you without risk.

   > Give towers some concept of champion aggression memory. Basically towers won't go back to shooting minions until there aren't any enemy champions in their range who've recently damaged one of their team's champions. Main impact of that is expected to be on champions that dive at low levels using untargetablity effects (Elise, Fizz etc). The ability to swap agro onto another champion's still there and still powerful, trying to defend a tower in those circumstances shouldn't be as lopsided though (risk just isn't there for the attacker at present). As with lane swaps we don't want to remove early tower diving, we don't think the risk being taken/price being paid's high enough though, leading to a situation where you just don't bother trying to defend at all (tower still goes down, you just go down with it).
